Description: Terracotta figure of panther. The forepart of a panther, well modelled, but broken off from behind the ribcage. The mouth is open and the forelegs reach forward: both are broken. Solid, made in a two-piece mould, with some hand-modelling and much incised detail, covered in a white coating and then tongue painted red, eye details in black. Pinkish clay (Aswan?) with a light-grey core.
Curator's comments: Possibly part of handle. Though the fabric is similar to Aswan pink fabric, it may be imported.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3739)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.266) (Phase 1)
Condition: Broken off behind ribcage. Both forelegs broken.
